summary: Yvonne W. Briggs was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978. These documents detail her position, annual salary, and pay period earnings during the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents span from May to November 1978, indicating her involvement with the HSCA during that period.
significance: Yvonne W. Briggs' significance lies in her role as an employee of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her work is not detailed in these documents, her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates her involvement in the committee's operations.
